20020226 + latest

i got (when stepping though) a dialog about a vm crash - with details given 
below
i run sun 1.4 rc on win2k

It's unclear if there's anything to be done here. I've compared the signature
handling in TypeImpl.signatureToTag with the JNI spec and it looks to be doing
the right thing - that is, it looks like the signature passed in must have been
invalid. The signature that's passed into this method comes from the VM (in
MethodImpl.variables()). If the VM crashed, it's possible that we got invalid
data from it.

It looks like we detected the invalid data and threw an appropriate
exception.--------------------------------------

Can you give more information about what you were doing when the VM crashed? Had
you performed a hot code replace or drop to frame before the VM died?

In all likelihood, what we have here is a VM bug that's causing the crash.

it happened only once so i can't be sure what caused it.
it is very likely that i'd performed hot code replace before

not sure if that was clear from the data i gave before - it was my eclipse 
runtime vm that crashed, not the target vm.
no idea what really happened - like i said, i saw it only once and the stack 
dump that i gave is the only thing i was left with.

Updated TypeImpl.signatureToTag to print out the signature it's trying to
convert in the case of a method signature. It's still unclear how a variable got
a method signature, but with this improved error reporting we may get a clue.
Please reopen if this ever occurs again.
Closing - nothing more to go on.

traces.message: Can't covert method signature to tag.
